meanings.definition: The original or earliest version of a text, especially a musical score.
meanings.sent1: The urtext of the song had handwritten notes from the composer.
meanings.sent2: I always refer to the urtext when studying music history.
meanings.sent3: The musicians joked that the urtext was so old, it was written in invisible ink.
meanings.sent4: To the conductor, the urtext was like a treasure map leading to the heart of the composition.
meanings.sent5: The urtext was carefully preserved in the library's archives.

meanings.definition: An authoritative or primary source text.
meanings.sent1: The professor always consulted the urtext for accurate information.
meanings.sent2: The urtext provided valuable insights into the historical period.
meanings.sent3: In the library, the urtext was kept under lock and key like a precious jewel.
meanings.sent4: To the students, the urtext was a beacon of knowledge in a sea of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The urtext was considered the holy grail of academic research.
